etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Bald's Leechbook. From post-classical Latin oxymel, oxymelle, variants (after classical Latin mell-, mel honey) of classical Latin oxymeli mixture of vinegar and honey from ancient Greek ὀξύμελι from ὀξυ- + μέλι honey

definitions: A medicinal drink or syrup made of vinegar and honey, sometimes with other ingredients.

notes.text: "oxymel of squills" noun oxymel made with bulbs of the squill, Drimia maritima.
